TITLE: Apla - Public blockchain platform for building digital ecosystems

SHOWREEL.TITLE: Apla
SHOWREEL.SLOGAN: Public blockchain platform for building digital ecosystems
SHOWREEL.TEXT: Create an ecosystem for developing and running blocking applications in one click.

TEXT.1: Simvolio is the language for writing smart contracts with fast compilation in byte code.
TEXT.2: Simvolio supports a standard set of statements and constructions, functions for handling database tables and an error handling system.
TEXT.3: The contract code is written in Molis editor.

TEXT.1: Each ecosystem has its own database. Database management tools are used to create tables, add columns and assign access rights.

Application user interfaces are written in Protypo, a special language of the template engine. The functions and constructions of the Protypo language enable you to obtain values from the database, build forms for transferring values to contracts and performing other operations.
TEXT.2: The interface page code is created in a special editor of software client Molis.

VISUAL.TITLE: Visual interface designer
VISUAL.TEXT: The visual interface designer allows to easily and quickly customize the appearance of application pages without resorting to HTML code. It is used to add text blocks, form and navigation elements, tables and diagrams to the page, as well as to configure their styles, position and sizes.

ECOSYSTEM.TITLE: Apla ecosystem
ECOSYSTEM.TEXT: Any owner of an Apla account can create his or her own ecosystem in one click. An ecosystem is a software environment for writing and running blockchain applications. Access to applications and right to participate in ecosystem management are owned by its members – Apla users invited by the ecosystem creator.
ECOSYSTEM.NAME: ecosystem
ECOSYSTEM.BOX: In the ecosystem, applications are available out-of-the-box

LIST.1: Financial system with configuration of emission parameters
LIST.2: System for managing ecosystem members and roles
LIST.3: News service with ratings, commenting posts and paying for activity
LIST.5: Messenger for messaging between ecosystem members

SOFTWARE.TITLE: Apla software client
SOFTWARE.TEXT: Molis is a single tool for accessing all Apla features. Molis contains an APL wallet and an integrated development environment for blockchain applications.

ACCESS.TITLE: Access control mechanism
ACCESS.TEXT: One of the main advantages of Apla over other blockchain platforms is that it has a multi-level access rights management mechanism in the ecosystem software environment.

DESCRIPTION.1: Access rights are set for all operations: creating and changing contracts, database tables, interfaces.
DESCRIPTION.2: Access rights can be provided to members of the ecosystem, to roles and to smart contracts.

PROSPECTS.TITLE: Development prospects for Apla
PROSPECTS.TEXT: We listed above what is already working, what is already available in the testnet test network, and what will function when Apla’s working version is launched in September 2017.

TEAM.TITLE: Team

1.NAME: Vitaly Bondar
1.TEXT: Vitaly is a Russian qualified lawyer and Legal Director of the Luxembourg based law firm ChristmannSchmitt. He is an expert in e-commerce and private international law matters. In the past 15 years, he has been holding senior positions at large international law firms and industrial companies with a focus on cross-border M&A deals and transaction structuring.  Vitaly graduated from the law faculty of Kuban State University, Russia, in 1999, and further obtained a postgraduate diploma (L.L.M) in International Banking and Commercial Law in 2001 from Queen Mary University in London.

2.NAME: Andrey Nechaev
2.TEXT: More than 5 years of experience in Software development. Excellent understanding of Web stack, mostly backend (Erlang, Java and Python). Developed applications on both front-end and high-loaded back-end sides. Experience with the most popular mobile platforms, cross-compilation for all popular desktop and mobile platforms. Focused on fault-tolerant distributed services and UX.

3.NAME: Lukman NH
3.TEXT: Blockchain Creative Publisher, Working in mineral Laboratory for government mining company, Passionated for blockchain implementation, 3 year experience in creative writing for blockchain development and promotion.

4.NAME: Anna Nosova
4.TEXT: Psychologist. 4 years of experience in the field of project promotion. 2 years of experience in the organization and management of social projects. Cooperated with international environmental and volunteer organizations: Peace Corp, Spare, Biomass Project, United Nations Development Programme. Is the author of the educational program and a number of scientific articles.

5.NAME: Yuriy Lomakin
5.TEXT: Front-end developer with 10-years experience. Worked in the team charmerstudio.com, developing major news portal lenta.ru.

6.NAME: Aleksandr Boldachev
6.TEXT: Philosopher, analyst, member of the Association of Russian Futurologists. Main research areas: global evolutionism, temporal ontology, philosophy of artificial intelligence, futurology. In recent years, he worked on creation of subject-event approach to complex systems modeling.

7.NAME: Alexey Krivonogov
7.TEXT: A professional C/C++ programmer with 24 years of experience. Graduated from Novosibirsk State University in 1992 with a degree in mathematics and applied mathematics. Developed programming language Gentee from scratch. Developed personal data store Eonza.

8.NAME: Jesus Pena
8.TEXT: Jesus Pena Garcia is 35 years old blockchain enthusiast, CMO in Alpla - electronic platform for creation the blockchain ecosystems that provides possibilities for managing governmental processes with help of smart-contracts and smart-laws. Apla is the first platform which allows uniting of all state activities on the one blockchain. Also Jesus is founder and CEO of Bitbank, a Fintech company located in Luxembourg. He moved to Luxembourg in 2014 to launch his own business, obtaining financial support from Luxembourg Government for his projects. He joined Grant Thornton Luxembourg in October 2015, where he takes the post of director of the initiative called GT Technology HUB.

9.NAME: Muhammed Arafath
9.TEXT: A graduate from Southern Cross University, Australia certified Blockchain business analyst, has 10+ years experience working with diverse verticals, industries and international markets. Currently exploring the intersection of artificial intelligence, blockchains and the internet of things. He is actively work with government and private organizations to help them adopt blockchain technology.

10.NAME: Oleg Strelenko
10.TEXT: Blockchain developer with 5 years of work experience. Developed decentralized electronic currency DCoin (80k lines of Go code) from scratch. He is known in the Russian IT community as Dmitry Kharitonov. For over 10 years, he has developed his own projects and managed IT teams.

LITE.HEAD: Apla v1.0 Lite beta
LITE.TEXT1: You can run the app and start working right away, there is no need to wait for blockchain synchronization.

FULL.HEAD: Apla Node v1.0 beta
FULL.TEXT1: You can launch your node, engage in forging or delegate forging. To start work, you must install PostgreSQL.

PRIVATE.HEAD: Apla Node v0.1 beta (private)
PRIVATE.TEXT1: Smart contracts, smart laws, states, citizens, etc.
PRIVATE.TEXT2: To start work, you must install PostgreSQL. The documentation is in the process of writing. You can also watch the video showing a part of the functionality of this version

SHOWREEL.TITLE: Apla for Government
SHOWREEL.TEXT: Instead of automating certain services and functions, Apla proposes to transfer all state activities to the blockchain platform

TEXT.1: This is not a means of digital modeling and automating the activities of the state within the existing legal framework.
TEXT.2: It is a tool for creating a fundamentally new social and legal system in which most legally significant relationships are automatically implemented by smart contacts under the control of smart laws within a single digital space.

LIST.1: Registries of all departments are located on one block platform
LIST.2: Smart contracts ensure the interaction of all registries
LIST.3: The legal system based on smart contracts regulates the implementation of smart contracts
LIST.4: The legislative system ensures the holding of elections to representative bodies and the adoption of smart laws

TEXT.1: For each department on the platform Apla creates its own ecosystem, which includes: registers, fraud-proof interfaces, smart contracts and smart regulations that regulate the work of smart contracts
TEXT.2: The secret part of the information the department can keep in its database, putting into the eGaaS ecosystem only the data necessary for interaction with other departments and users.
TEXT.3: The interaction of departments with each other, as well as with individuals and legal entities is controlled by global smart laws of the state platform.

LIST.2: system of establishment and appointment of posts (roles)
LIST.4: the system of notification of persons and posts about events

BENEFITS.TITLE: Platform Advantages
BENEFITS.TEXT: for which it is worth using Apla as a tool for building e-Government

LIST.1: Low Costsfor deploying the platform's blockbuster and fast application development.
LIST.3: Flexible managementparameters of ecosystems and platforms using smart laws.
LIST.4: common digital environmentthe possibility of using the platform Apla eGaas as a single digital environment for the implementation of activities in any areas (financial, business, social)

SHOWREEL.TITLE: Apla for Business
SHOWREEL.TEXT: for the creation of digital ecosystems for the organization of financial, commercial and other economic activities

TEXT.1: On a private platform, many ecosystems can be deployed, interacting with each other through a single block.
TEXT.2: These are autonomous digital environments in which the initial implementation

LIST.1: Data storage with the ultimate protection of their unauthorized modification
LIST.2: Multi-level structure for managing access rights to data and applications based on roles
LIST.3: Smart contracts-software modules that perform operations with data with preservation of their reliability
LIST.4: Smart-laws-software modules that set conditions and restrictions on the implementation of smart contracts

FUNCTIONAL.TITLE: The need for a platform
FUNCTIONAL.TEXT: The Apla for Business platform is primarily necessary for the organization of economic activity, in which a large number of counterparties need to have a permanent and reliable access to a single stream of events, and event data must be extremely protected from tampering.
FUNCTIONAL.HEAD: These are such businesses as:

LIST.3: Smart home and smart things (Internet things)
LIST.5: service of signing and changing contracts

BENEFITS.TEXT: for which it is worth using Apla for Business as a tool for creating business ecosystems
